audit: None
deatails:
1.SPA.EFB.NO AFM found in the aircraft ,pilot say that we do not need AFM,We have I Pads.
2.CAT.GEN.MPA.180Operator OM-Part B for B787dated 01.02.2022 in the IPADs EFB,FCOM dated 01.03.2024 .
3.ORO.GEN.110 Both QRHs dp not have approval pages from SCAAand are not properly secured,loose items placed behid each pilot's seats during take off landing and of course during emergency evacuation might create .
4.CAT.GEN.MPA.180 Technikal Log Book was poot onto floor by crew ,explaning that no other place to put it during take off ,landing and emergency evacuation might create problem.
5. CAT>GEN.MPA.141,CAT.OP.MPA.175 Fuel is taken by crew 32000 kg explaning that there is a turbulence ,but did not indicate in the DUE section why?
6.ORO.FTLOperator does not have approved FTSS.
7.ORO.GEN.110/ORO.MLR.100 PICUS during briefing in the aircraft did not mention anything about  MEL,CDL,DMI,but there were some.
8.CAT.OP.MPA.160 Crew handbaggage is not properly secured, during take off ,landing and emergency evacuation might create problems.
9. CAT.GEN.MPA.170 The operator does not have any psychoactive substance in the OM-Part A,OM-part D .
10. ORO.MLR .100 NO performance calcualtion is conducted before descent. There was a PICUS in the airplane ,and TRI had not asked the PICUS  any questions,nor had the PICUS been taught anything by the TRI.
root_cause_details:
1) Absence of procedure about the necessity to have AFM in installed EFBs, if the document is already uploaded to portativ EFBs (iPads)
2) Lack of control over documentation to be uploaded to iPads
3) Difficulties in placing QRH to the site designed for it due to changes in the document caused an increase in its volume and a change of current cover page to thicker one
4) Human factor
5) Technical issue within "Meridian" software
6) Human factor - pilots could not find related information in the OM-A.
7) Misunderstanding during the inspection between the inspector and the PICUS
8) Human factor
9) Human factor - pilots could not show related information in the OM-A.
10) Human factor
corrective_action_details:
1) FOSS and pilots will be informed about the necessity of uploading AFM to installed EFBs as well.
2) Technical pilots will be informed about the necessity to keep control over the matter.
3) QRH will be rearranged, its cover page will be changed, and the document will be placed in proper place in cockpit.
4) Flight crew will be informed about suitable site in cockpit to place Technical Logbook.
5) Technical issue within “Meridian” will be resolved, flight crew will be informed about the necessity to fill in respective field within the software.
6) Related extract from OM-A will be provided to the SCAA.
7) Explanation of the PIC will be provided to the SCAA.
8) Flight crew will be informed about suitable site in cockpit to place hand baggage.
9) Related extracts from OM-A and OM-D will be provided to the SCAA.
10) FOD managers and flight crew will be informed about the necessity to conduct performance calculation before descent.
preventive_action_details:
1) Overall control regarding upload of documents to EFBs will be enhanced by FOSS.
2) Overall control regarding upload of documents to EFBs will be enhanced by FOSS and Technical pilots.
3) Overall control over manufacture documentation will be strengthened by FOSS.
4) Overall control over awareness of crew regarding such issues will be increased.
5) Overall control over awareness of crew regarding such issues will be increased.
6) Control over awareness of crew regarding provisions of OM-A will be improved.
7) Coordination during such inspections will be enhanced.
8) Overall control over awareness of crew regarding such issues will be increased.
9) Control over awareness of crew regarding provisions of Operations Manuals will be improved.
10) Overall control over awareness of crew regarding such issues will be enhanced.
follow_up_details:
NOTE  the fact that a technical error occurred when transferring the results of the inspection to the reporting form and the remarks were not correctly replaced with grades 1 and 2. Therefore, only grade 1 is reflected as a remark in the reporting form.
Currently, this technical inconsistency has been eliminated and the remarks in the table have been reclassified accordingly with grades 1 and 2.
implementing_action_details: Evidence will be uploaded to "Properties" part.

audit: AUD613 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001) Ramp Inspection Cessna 172S/Diamond DA42NG
deatails: The organisation does not comply with the requirements of AAR-145.48 / 145.50. Although the final step of the “ALF CHECK” procedure applicable to the Cessna 172S aircraft (registration 4K-AZ95) requires the aircraft to be washed, this task is not being performed in practice. During the inspection, the aircraft was observed to be dirty and in a neglected condition. This indicates that maintenance is not being carried out in accordance with the approved technical data. (see Evidence 5)

audit: AUD594 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Flight Recorder Serviceability Survey (Boeing 757/767/777)
deatails:
AAR-M, M.302 - CVR ULB OPT:
    1.1 EO-777-23-002 in section CTC of AMP - No reference to Boeing task in reference column
    1.2 BTC 23-100-00 in section SYS of AMP:
         1.2.1 No reference to EO-777-23-002 in reference column
         1.2.2 Interval is different than EO-777-23-002
         1.2.3 No referred to KX
         1.2.4 As per “B777 4K-AI001 Last Done_Next Due Report” last performed on 11.05.2024 with almost 5 months overdue – deadline was 20.12.2023
root_cause_details:
OP02 -Unclear/unavailable/inadequate regulations, standard procedures
EO issued by Engineering Section were not correlated with current MP due to lack of coordination.
corrective_action_details:
AMP (AHY-B777-MP-VIP) rev.12 will be reviewed to add:
1.1 Boeing Task Card in reference column of EO-777-23-002
1.2.1 EO-777-23-002 in reference column of BTC 23-100-00
1.2.2 BTC was issued through EO (EO-777-23-002 Rev 00 fully covers BTC 23-100-00-01). 
1.2.3 BTC was issued through EO (EO-777-23-002 Rev 00 fully covers BTC 23-100-00-01).
1.2.4 TC Extension Approval Form was issued within 20.12.2023-20.03.2024. 
The aircraft was on a check within 10.03.2024 – 11.05.2024 (evidence attached).
preventive_action_details: EO will be crosschecked with relevant AMP TC and AzSCAA requirements to ensure all references included.
accesptance_action_details:
Conditionally accepted! "2.2 BTC was issued through EO (EO-777-23-002 Rev 00 fully covers BTC 23-100-00-01). 
1.2.3 BTC was issued through EO (EO-777-23-002 Rev 00 fully covers BTC 23-100-00-01)"  - The intervals of the EO and BTC require alignment to ensure consistency!

audit: AUD594 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Flight Recorder Serviceability Survey (Boeing 757/767/777)
deatails:
AAR-FR, Appendix 1, 7.2; AAR-M, M.302:
    1.1 The DLR recording inspection task is not included in the AMP, indicating that this requirement is not being fulfilled.
    1.2 Examination result (report) of the recorded messages on the DLR is not available.
root_cause_details:
OP03 - Inadequate operations
Flight Data Analysis Group was not authorized to perform DLR readout on Boeing (767/777).
Boeing 757 is not equipped with ACARS (DLR), thus requirement not applicable.
corrective_action_details: Specified procedures (DLR readout) will be transferred to CAMO proposed External Service Provider (L3 Harris) by the end of Sept 2025.

audit: AUD594 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Flight Recorder Serviceability Survey (Boeing 757/767/777)
deatails:
AAR-FR, Appendix 1, 7.3:
    1.1 Flight Data Recorder Readout Report 4K-AI001-2024-GD00355163:
         1.1.1 The FDR part number was indicated in the column intended for the FDR model.
         1.1.2 Date significantly different on report and on plot parameters
    1.2 Operator FR Serviceability Report (4K-AI001-2024) - the Report is dated 02.12.2024, which is week later than the date of the associated Readout Report 4K-AI001-2024-GD00355163 (25.11.2024).

audit: None
deatails: AMC2.SPA.EFB.100(B) Check for updates Company Manuals.CAT.GEN.MPA.180 OM-B.ORO.GEN.110 AFM revision and OM-A revisions.CAT.OP.MPA.182 QRH approval pages ..CAT.OP.MPA 175,180.195 Fuel calculation.
root_cause_details:
1) Human factor - crew member could not demonstrate required action in iPads.
2) Technical feature of Jeppesen OPT.
3) Mentioned OM-B did not exist for time of the inspection, so it could not be in the Company Manuals/Publications.
4) Technical issue regarding installed EFB.
5) Approval page given by the SCAA does not correspond with the rest part of hardcopy QRH on board (respective paper material). On other hand, presence of approval page in QRH uploaded to iPads (softcopy) seemed to be enough to resolve the issue.
6) Human factor - captain could not indicate required section in iPad.
7) Technical issue.
8) Technical issue regarding installed EFB.
corrective_action_details:
1) Respective crew members will be informed about presence of "CHECK FOR UPDATES" function in OPT/ACTIONS. Evidence will be provided to the SCAA.
2) As the issue is related to built-in feature of Jeppesen, it is considered that current situation may be used in the future as well, as Documents is more user-friendly application. Evidence of presence of manuals in Documents application will be sent to the SCAA. 
3) OM-B had been created and uploaded to Company Manuals/Publications section. Evidence will be sent to the SCAA.
4) The issue has been resolved and right now information uploaded to aircraft-installed EFBs corresponds with the data in portative ones. Evidence will be provided to the SCAA.
5) Photo of QRH approval page from iPads will be provided to the SCAA.
6) Crew will be informed about presence of respective section in iPADs. Evidence will be sent to the SCAA.
7) Required function was adjusted. Evidence will be provided to the SCAA.
8) The issue has been resolved and right now information uploaded to aircraft-installed EFBs corresponds with the data in portative ones. Evidence will be provided to the SCAA.
preventive_action_details:
1) AHY will pay special attention to notification of pilots regarding functions in iPads.
2) The Operator will be vigilant regarding such matters in the future.
3) The airline will pay additional attention to presence of required manuals in iPads.
4) AZAL will pay special attention to technical issues, which occur with iPads.
5) AHY will pay attention to such matters in the future.
6) AHY will pay special attention to notification of pilots regarding functions in iPads.
7) ZAL will pay special attention to technical issues, which occur with iPads.
8) ZAL will pay special attention to technical issues, which occur with iPads.
implementing_action_details: Evidence will be uploaded to "Properties" part.

audit: AUD557 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Airbus A319/A320/A340(ACAM In-depth Survey)
deatails:
References: M.302, M.708(b)(1), (b)(2) & (b)(4), M.803)
1. Referenced documents in the paragraph 1.2 of the AMP is not covered all related documents for AMP creations (for example these documents missed: AAR-CAMO, Engine manual etc.).
2. During the review of the Approved Maintenance Program (AMP), it was identified that certain Airworthiness Directives (ADs) ( Example: 2011-0160, 2011-0155, 2013-0288) have been superseded, but the AMP has not been updated to reflect the active AD references. As a result, maintenance tasks continue to reference obsolete ADs, which could lead to non-compliance with the latest regulatory requirements.
root_cause_details: Lack of training on AMP.
corrective_action_details: The AMP will be updated and submitted to the SCAA by 2 May 2025.
preventive_action_details: The Excel file for AMP tracking will be sent to CAMO on a weekly basis to check the current version of the MPD.

audit: None
deatails:
#1  CAT.OP.MPA.225 Before flight  the inspector observed that the seatbelt on passenger seat 25C is worn out. The issue was noted in the logbook by the senior cabin crew member.

#2CAT.IDE.A.175
CAT.IDE.A.180
CAT.IDE.A.100
On the Tel Aviv – Baku destination, the inspector discovered that the intercommunication handsets 4R and 4L displays were malfunctioning. The number dialling combination in order to communication between the crew were not displayed on the screens. The issue was noted in the logbook by the senior cabin crew member after flight.
root_cause_details: TN01- Inappropriate/poor design of equipment, tool, parts, material
corrective_action_details: Identified defects will be rectified until the end of May 2025.
preventive_action_details: Oversight of A/C interior conditions will be increased by CAMO.
implementing_action_details: Defects were rectified as per attached NRCs.

audit: AUD558 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Airbus A319/A320/A340 (Reliability Programme Survey)
deatails: The reliability program doesn’t fully comply with requirements of AAR.M Appendix I to AMC M.302 (6.2.2). Not all fleet reliability report was provided (A340 fleet missing)
root_cause_details: The A340-542 fleet  (4K-AZ85 and 4K-AZ86) is currently unserviceable.
corrective_action_details: A340 fleet will be removed from CAME  by 15th July 2025.
preventive_action_details: A periodic review process will be implemented to ensure that unserviceable or inactive aircraft are promptly assessed and, if necessary, formally removed from the CAME to maintain accuracy and regulatory compliance.

audit: AUD558 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Airbus A319/A320/A340 (Reliability Programme Survey)
deatails: The reliability program doesn’t fully comply with requirements of AAR.M Appendix I to AMC M.302 (6.5.3). The definition section missing.
root_cause_details: OP02 - Unclear/unavailable/inadequate regulations, standard procedures
corrective_action_details: The Reliability Procedure (Ref: AHY-CAM-PRO-0002) will be reviewed by 15th July 2025 to add definition section.
preventive_action_details: AAR regulation training will be included in the initial and recurrent training program for relevant CAMO personnel to ensure continued awareness and compliance with regulatory requirements.

audit: AUD558 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Airbus A319/A320/A340 (Reliability Programme Survey)
deatails: The reliability program doesn’t fully comply with requirements of AAR.M Appendix I to AMC M.302 (6.5.4). Aircraft General Information: flight hours and cycles; Operational data, defect classification and many other data missing.
root_cause_details: OP02 - Unclear/unavailable/inadequate regulations, standard procedures
corrective_action_details: The Reliability Procedure (Ref: AHY-CAM-PRO-0002) will be reviewed by 15th July 2025 to add reliability report criteria (e.g. Aircraft General Information).
preventive_action_details: AAR regulation training will be included in the initial and recurrent training program for relevant CAMO personnel to ensure continued awareness and compliance with regulatory requirements.

audit: AUD558 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Airbus A319/A320/A340 (Reliability Programme Survey)
deatails: The reliability program doesn’t fully comply with requirements of AAR.M. Appendix I to AMC M.302 (6.5.6). The reliability report does not contain any data showing that the CAMO examines, analyses, or interprets the reliability data.
root_cause_details: OP02 - Unclear/unavailable/inadequate regulations, standard procedures
corrective_action_details: The Reliability Procedure (Ref: AHY-CAM-PRO-0002) will be reviewed by 15th July 2025 to add reliability report criteria.
preventive_action_details: AAR regulation training will be included in the initial and recurrent training program for relevant CAMO personnel to ensure continued awareness and compliance with regulatory requirements.

audit: AUD594 - Azerbaijan Airlines (CAMO-001), Flight Recorder Serviceability Survey (Boeing 757/767/777)
deatails:
AAR-FR, Appendix 1, 7.3 - Cockpit Voice Recorder Replay Evaluation Report #423:
    1.1 The CVR part number was indicated in the column intended for the CVR type.
    1.2 Contains no input in the “Comments” section.
root_cause_details:
EV02 - Rules, regulations, procedures not followed:
Insufficient attentiveness of flight data analysis staff during preparation of the reports.
corrective_action_details:
Cockpit Voice Recorder Replay Evaluation Report will be reviewed:
1.1 CVR type column will be changed to CVR part number.
1.2 "Comments" section will be filled accordingly.
